holidays.name: Pi Approximation Day
holidays.description: A whimsical celebration of the mathematical constant œÄ (pi) approximated as 22/7! Math enthusiasts and number nerds rejoice on this day with pie-eating contests, math puzzles, and pi-themed parties.
holidays.origin: The date 22/7 (July 22) is used because 22 divided by 7 is a common fractional approximation of pi.
holidays.funFact: Pi Approximation Day celebrates a rational approximation, whereas the actual value of pi is an irrational number with infinite non-repeating decimals.

holidays.name: Ratcatcher's Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the legendary Ratcatcher of Hamelin, who is said to have rid the town of rats‚Äîand then mysteriously disappeared with the children! A quirky day to honor pest control and folklore.
holidays.origin: Based on the folkloric tale from Hamelin, Germany, where the Pied Piper lured away rats (then children) from the town in the Middle Ages.
holidays.funFact: Some versions of the Ratcatcher's story suggest it is a metaphor for the Black Death and its impact on European towns.

holidays.name: Pi Approximation Day (Alternate)
holidays.description: Even more math fun celebrating pi‚Äînot the exact date, but the fraction 22/7 that approximates it. Math geeks use this day to nerd out on calculations, constants, and sometimes eat lots of pie!
holidays.origin: The fraction 22 over 7, known since antiquity as a handy way to approximate pi, led to this numeric celebration.
holidays.funFact: Archimedes first provided 22/7 as an approximation for pi over 2000 years ago!

holidays.name: Moon Day
holidays.description: Remembering the first manned Moon landing by Apollo 11 astronauts in 1969, this day honors space exploration and humanity‚Äôs giant leap.
holidays.origin: July 20-22 marks the first successful Moon landing orbit and return to Earth by Apollo 11 astronauts in 1969, with some celebrations extending to July 22.
holidays.funFact: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin spent about 21 hours on the lunar surface, but Moon Day celebrations sometimes include the whole duration of the mission ending July 22.
